stem: Which assessment finding requires immediate intervention by the nurse?

itemContext.sbar:
14:00, S: 78-year-old male admitted from home with fever, cough, and increased shortness of breath. Suspect pneumonia. Hx of COPD, HTN, T2DM. O2 @ 2L NC. B/P trending down since admission. 
14:15, B: Patient presented to ED yesterday with similar symptoms, discharged after nebulizer treatment. Symptoms worsened overnight. 
14:30, A: Increased work of breathing, weak cough. SpO2 90% on 2L NC. Auscultation reveals coarse crackles bilaterally. Patient reports feeling weak and confused. 
14:45, R: Anticipate orders for repeat chest x-ray, blood cultures, antibiotics. Consider increasing oxygen delivery. Notify provider of B/P changes.

tabs.title: Vitals
tabs.content:
14:30:
Temperature: 102.8°F (39.3°C)
Heart Rate: 122 bpm
Respiratory Rate: 28 breaths/min
Blood Pressure: 90/50 mmHg
Oxygen Saturation: 90% on 2L NC

tabs.title: Radiology
tabs.content:
Chest X-Ray (14:15):
Infiltrate in the right lower lobe

tabs.title: MAR
tabs.content:
Ceftriaxone 1g IV q24h

Acetaminophen 650mg PO q4h PRN

rationale.correct: A blood pressure of 90/50 mmHg, in the context of fever, elevated WBC, and elevated lactate, indicates hypotension related to possible sepsis, requiring immediate intervention such as fluid resuscitation and vasopressors. Sepsis-induced hypotension can lead to inadequate tissue perfusion and organ damage.
rationale.incorrect: A heart rate of 122 bpm is elevated (tachycardia), but expected given the fever and possible sepsis. While it requires monitoring, the hypotension is a more critical and immediate threat to the patient's perfusion and oxygenation.
clinicalPearls: Hypotension unresponsive to initial fluid resuscitation is a key indicator of septic shock, a life-threatening condition.
Early recognition and treatment of sepsis are critical to improving patient outcomes and preventing multi-organ failure.
Lactate level is an important indicator of tissue hypoxia in sepsis, reflecting anaerobic metabolism due to inadequate oxygen delivery.

questionTrap.trap: Focusing on individual abnormal vital signs instead of recognizing the overall clinical picture of possible septic shock. While elevated temperature, tachycardia, and decreased oxygen saturation are concerning, hypotension is the most immediately life-threatening finding.

mnemonic.name: S.E.P.S.I.S.
mnemonic.meaning: Seek expert help (early), Evaluate source, Prevent hypotension, Stabilize blood sugar, Initiate antibiotics, Serial lactate measurements.
